FILE: cm315713v11.0.txt
DYAD: CZECHOSLOVAKIA - TAIWAN
RIVALRY: RIV830
DISPUTE(S): MID3203 

PS-LAST-CHANGED: 20180410
PS-LAST-CHECKED: 20180722

Territorial-Maritime-Boundary Issues Variables

MID3203 

TERRMID: MID3203 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID3203 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID3203 1 -- third party link to territorial MID
TERRLINK-CER: MID3203 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID3203 see CIVWARMID-NOTES for this MID for full description of event. Coded third party link to territorial MID because this is connected to the Chinese Civil War, which has a territorial dispute element as nationalists and communists were fighting to control all of China but were each in control of territorially distinct states (China and Taiwan) at this point. 

MARITMID: MID3203 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID3203 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID3203 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID3203 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID3203 1 -- civil war MID
CIVWARMID-CER: MID3203 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: MID3203 from Gibler 2018, Czechoslovakia protested the seizure of one of their merchant ships by nationalist forces. The ship was transporting goods purchased from Communist China. Coded civil war link because this was connected to the Chinese Civil War (nationalists vs. communists), which featured regular seizures of transported goods as a way of inflicting economic harm during the war. 

CIVWARLINK: MID3203 1 -- civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID3203 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: MID3203 also coded civil war link because the civil war element of this was includes China, outside of this dyad. 

COUPMID: MID3203 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID3203 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID3203 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID3203 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 


RIVNOTES: 

NARRATIVE-CM:

SOURCES-CM:

NARRATIVE-CR:

SOURCES-CR:

SOURCES: Gibler 2018
